properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 6 at 5:19AM EST until February 8 at 1:45AM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
...Observed Flooding Changed from Minor to Minor Severity for the
following rivers in Georgia...

...Forecast Flooding Changed from Minor to Moderate Severity for the
following rivers in Georgia...

Lookout Creek near New England affecting Dade and Hamilton
Counties


.Recent heavy rainfall has caused significant runoff into streams and
rivers which will cause flooding in some areas.
properties.instruction:
All persons with interests along the river should monitor the latest
forecasts...and be prepared to take necessary precautions to protect
life and property.

The latest stage data was furnished in cooperation with the United
States Geological Survey.

NWSheadline: Forecast flooding increased from Minor to Moderate severity...The Flood Warning continues for The Lookout Creek near New England. * Until late Friday night. * At 05AM Thursday the stage was 16.7 feet...and rising. * Minor flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast. * Flood stage is 12 feet. * The river will continue rising to near 18 feet by this evening. The river will fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. * At 19.0 feet...Major Flooding begins. Several homes begin to flood near Sells Lane and Lookout Creek Road and many buildings near Creek Road and the New England hang gliding park. In addition
